entry.title: Smart Contract Tokens and Defi Sector Suffer Steep Losses, Threatening TVL to Fall Below $40 Billion
entry.summary:
The overall value of the crypto economy has dropped by more than 5% against the US dollar in the past 24 hours, with the top smart contract token sector losing more than 8% in the same time frame. The downturn has also affected the decentralized finance (defi) sector, with the total value locked in defi today awfully close to dropping below the $40 billion range after shedding 5.65% in value over the last day.
TVL Nears the $40 Billion Range, Three Tokens Record Heavy Losses
The total value locked (TVL) in decentralized finance (defi) has decreased by 8.97% from $47.12 billion on June 5 to $42.89 billion on June 10, 2023, at 8:30 a.m. (ET). This loss amounts to approximately $4.23 billion in five days. The majority of these losses occurred during the last day, as the crypto economy andâ€¦

entry.title: Nigeria regulator says Binance not registered and must stop soliciting investors: Reuters
Biggest Movers: ADA, MATIC Plunge by Nearly 25%, Following Robinhood Delisting
entry.summary:
Cardano fell by over 25% on Saturday, as traders continued to react to the token being delisted from the Robinhood platform. The global cryptocurrency market cap is currently down by nearly 6%, following these developments. Polygon, which was also delisted, dropped to a one-year low to start the weekend.
Cardano (ADA)
Cardano (ADA) dropped markedly on Saturday, as traders continued to react to the token being delisted from the Robinhood platform.
Following a high of $0.3218 on Friday, ADA/USD slipped to a bottom at $0.2304 to start the weekend.
Looking at the chart, the decline came as the relative strength index (RSI) plunged below a floor at the 30.00 mark, entering oversold territory.
At the time of writing, the index is currently tracking at 17.75.
ADA is currently trading at $0.2509, down 22% from yesterdayâ€™s peak.
Polygon (MATIC)
Additionally, polygon (MATIC) lost a significant amount of its value to start the weekend, nearing a one-year low in the process.
MATIC/USD sank to a bottom at $0.5605 on Saturday, as prices dropped by nearly 30% from yesterdayâ€™s high.
As a result of this decline, the worldâ€™s twelfth-largest cryptocurrency moved to its lowest point since last July.
Overall, the token is now down close to 40% in the last seven-days, after breaking out of a support point at $0.75.
This has also led to the 10-day (red) moving average (MA) extending a downwards crossover versus the 25-day (blue) MA.
Price strength is also deeply oversold with a reading of 16.22, which is an all-time low point.
Register your email here to get weekly price analysis updates sent to your inbox:
Do you expect further declines in polygon in the coming days? Let us know your thoughts in the comments.

entry.title: Crypto Queen Adviser, Under House Arrest, Goes Missing Before Facing US Justice
entry.summary:
The Crypto Queen accomplice, like his former boss Ruja Ignatova, has disappeared prior to facing legal proceedings in the United States.Â
Frank Schneider, who worked as the â€œcrisis managerâ€ and security advisor for OneCoinâ€™s mastermind Ignatova, is currently evading authorities and is being pursued by the French legal system.Â
Schneider, 53, was placed under house arrest in France while awaiting extradition to the US.
The Crypto Queen Accomplice Evades Justice, Questions Fair Trial
Initially apprehended by French authorities in April 2021 while traveling with his family near the Luxembourg border, Schneider endured a seven-month incarceration before being granted release under house arrest.
Accused of participating in a massive cryptocurrency scam worth $4 billion, Schnâ€¦

entry.title: How I Missed The Early Days Of Bitcoin
entry.summary: This is an opinion editorial by Enza Coin, a Bitcoin-focused investor and content creator. The other day I was looking through my closet and found a pair of my old FitFlops. Does anyone remember these? FitFlops sold for some $100 and promised to work your legs into shape just by walking. Seeing them made me recall the time I spent traveling across Asia from around 2008 onward. In those years and into the early 2010s, I was busy managing a company based in Hong Kong while accompanying my then boyfriend/fiancÃ© around Asia. He worked on various finance projects with governments in the region, flashing his MBA, two masterâ€™s degrees and finance background while I occupied my days, and some nights, with corporate matters and adding to my investment portfolio. In those days, that meant investingâ€¦

entry.title: Bitcoin, Ethereum Technical Analysis: BTC Falls Below $26,000, as Traders Digest SECâ€™s Crypto Crackdown
entry.summary:
Bitcoin moved below the $26,000 level to start the weekend, as bearish pressure intensified following a week of turbulence. Sentiment in the market once again shifted, as traders liquidated their positions on the back of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commissionâ€™s (SEC) crackdown on crypto. ETH dropped below $1,800.
Bitcoin
Bitcoin (BTC) started the weekend trading below $26,000, as traders continued to react to the fallout of the SECâ€™s cryptocurrency crackdown.
The latest domino to fall came in the form of Robinhood, who moved to delist several altcoins from its platform, including solana and cardano.
BTC/USD fell to an intraday low of $25,502 in the news, which comes a day after price peaked at $26,770.
Looking at the chart, the latest downturn came as the 14-day relative strength index (RSI) fell towards a floor at 39.00
At the time of writing, the index is tracking marginally above this point at 40.06.
In addition to this, the 10-day (red) moving average has extended its downward cross versus its 25-day (blue) counterpart, putting further emphasis on the current bearish sentiment.
Ethereum
Bears were also present in ethereum (ETH), which dropped below the $1,800 level to start the weekend.
After climbing to a peak of $1,861.14 on Friday, ETH/USD slipped to a bottom of $1,721 earlier in todayâ€™s session.
The move saw ethereum plunge to its weakest point since late April, breaking out of a floor at $1,730 in the process.
As a result of this shift in market momentum, the RSI also tailed off, dropping to its lowest level since March.
The index is currently at a reading below 40.00, which is close to oversold territory, and could act as a slight positive for bulls.
In the event price becomes more oversold, there is a good chance that longer term bulls could move to buy the dip.
Register your email here to get weekly price analysis updates sent to your inbox:
Could there be more regulatory crackdowns on crypto companies next week? Leave your thoughts in the comments below.

entry.title: Ethereum Success Hinges On Vitalik Buterinâ€™s Proposed â€˜3 Transitionsâ€™ â€“ What Are They?
entry.summary:
Ethereum, the renowned blockchain platform and brainchild of Vitalik Buterin, faces a crucial crossroad on its path to further growth and adoption.Â
In a blog post recently shared by the Ethereum co-founder himself, Buterin highlights the imperative need for three pivotal transitions that Ethereum must undergo in order to ensure its prosperous future.Â
These transitions, aptly dubbed â€œThe Three Transitions,â€ revolve around the realms of Layer-2 scaling solutions, the implementation of smart contract wallets, and the augmentation of privacy in fund transfers.Â
Without embracing these transformative changes, Buterin says Ethereum risks hindering its own expansion and jeopardizing its position as a frontrunner in the ever-evolving landscape of decentralized technologies.
Layer-2 Scaâ€¦

entry.title: Custodia's Suit Against Fed Over Denial of Master Account Can Proceed, Court Rules
entry.summary: Custodia's challenge of the Federal Reserve Bank of Kansas City's decision to deny the crypto-friendly bank access to the Fed banking services can continue, a U.S. district court ruled Thursday, rejecting a Fed motion to dismiss the case. The U.S. District Court of Wyoming, however, did reject Custodia's request that the Fed be compelled to grant it a so-called master account and membership with the Fed, Instead, Custodia must continue its claims via normal channels.

entry.summary:
Binance US has informed its users that U.S. dollar deposits have been suspended and USD withdrawals will no longer be processed. The crypto exchange has asked customers to withdraw dollars by June 13 as it transitions into a crypto-only trading platform. The move followed a lawsuit against the crypto exchange and several other Binance entities by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC).

entry.title: 2 Russian Citizens Behind 2011 Hack of Mt. Gox, US Alleges
entry.summary: US prosecutors have fingered two Russian nationals as the masterminds behind the 2011 hack of Mt. Gox, the largest Bitcoin (BTC) exchange in the world at the time. The Department of Justice (DOJ) in an indictment unsealed on Friday, charged Alexey Bilyuchenko, 43, and Aleksandr Verner, 29, with conspiracy to launder about 647,000 bitcoins following their hack of the exchange. DOJ Indicts Two Russian Nationals According to the prosecutors, Bilyuchenko and Verner stole the vast majority of bitcoins belonging to Mt. Gox customers between September 2011 and at least May 2014. This contributed to the eventual shut down of the platform in February 2014. The DOJ in a statement unsealed charges against both Russian nationals in both New York and California, following ongoinâ€¦

entry.summary: Documents filed as part of the ongoing court case between the SEC and Binance allege that Gary Gensler and Changpeng Zhao have history.

entry.title: How 1 Simple Question Kickstarted Performance Artist Foodmasku's Plunge Into NFTs
entry.summary: As his food mask creations went viral on the Internet during the COVID lockdowns, reposted on TikTok and Instagram without his consent, he soon asked: "How do I protect my digital files?" Performance artist Foodmasku describes at this year's NFC Lisbon how that simple question spiraled into a minting collection after collection of his edible works.

entry.title: Arianee CEO Pegs Wine and Spirits as Next 'Exciting' Industry to Make Web3 Leap
entry.summary: CEO and co-founder of Arianee Pierre Nicolas Hurstel unpacks the wide spectrum of digital collectibles from 10,000 PFP collections to access passes for exclusive events. And with an unannounced big brand soon joining, Hurstel revealed at NFC Lisbon which kind of NFTs big brands are moving towards.

entry.title: Cathie Wood's ARK Bought $22M Worth of Coinbase Shares After the Price Tanked
entry.summary: ARK Invest is the second largest COIN shareholder behind Vanguard Group.

entry.summary: The SEC has gone after the two major crypto brands this weekâ€”but with very different allegations.

entry.title: Did Apple's Headset Reveal Revive the Web3 Metaverseâ€”Or Kill It?
entry.summary: Apple's Vision Pro could inject much-needed life into the sagging metaverse industry, but can the tech giant complement Web3's open ethos?

entry.title: Radio Host Sues OpenAI for Libel After ChatGPT Accuses Him of Crime
entry.summary: The Georgia-based broadcaster claims defamation after ChatGPT allegedly said he embezzled funds.

entry.title: Why 'Words With Friends' Creator Paul Bettner is 'Allergic' to Pay-to-Win NFTs
entry.summary: Words With Friends and Wildcard creator Paul Bettner tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about his perspective on what to do when NFTs become in-game characters and assets.

entry.summary: Twitch and Fractal co-founder Justin Kan and Fractal co-founder Dan Borstelmann share their perspectives on Web3 gaming's changing landscape with Decrypt's Kate Irwin.

entry.summary: Everquest developer turned Avalon Chief Product Officer Jeffrey Butler tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson about how he got into game development.

entry.title: The Machines Arena Game Preview: Is This the Next Overwatch?
entry.summary: Decrypt contributor Ryan S. Gladwin shares an inside look at The Machines Arena, an upcoming top-down 4v4 shooter from Directive Games that will offer NFTs minted on Ethereum sidechain network Ronin.

entry.title: You 'Have' to Be on Mobile: InfiniGods Cofounders on Gaming
entry.summary: InfiniGods developers Damon Gura and Owen Oâ€™Donoghue share their stance on why mobile gaming is essential to Web3 adoption and general success in the video games industry.

entry.title: Crypto Chaos of 2022 'Didn't Damage Technology Underlying the Industry': X Ventures Co-Founder Matthias Reiser
entry.summary: Ahead of this month's Proof of Talk event in Paris on June 14 and June 15, X Ventures co-founder and the event's co-organizer Dr. Matthias Reiser said nothing's changed for those with a "long-term view" of the industry. Still, events like the collapse of Terra and FTX in 20222 have certainly damaged investors' trust in crypto.

entry.title: Tron's Justin Sun Thinks Hong Kong Will Be a Big Fiat Onramp for Crypto
entry.summary: Justin Sun, Tron founder and advisor to crypto exchange Huobi, talks to Decrypt's Liam Kelly and Stacy Elliott about the impact of Hong Kong allowing residents to trade crypto, complications of restricting access based on location, and how AI will change the industry.

entry.title: NVIDIA's AI Push Could Change Gaming Forever
entry.summary: Computer tech firm NVIDIA profited off the crypto mining industry. Now, it's looking to artificial intelligenceâ€”and its stock price is soaring.

entry.summary: The InfiniGods founders share their approach to game development and offer a critique of games that call themselves "AAA."

entry.title: Make it Fast, Make it Friendly: Jerome de Tychey Unpacks Key Themes at This Year's EthCC
entry.summary: After six years running, EthCC is back, this time in Paris from July 17 to July 20. Decrypt sat down with the brains behind one of Ethereumâ€™s longest-running events Jerome de Tychey to get an inside look into whatâ€™s on the agenda this year, several unannounced guests, and the rollout of at least one â€œsecretâ€ DeFi project.

entry.title: Unioverse Game Preview: Hands-on With the Cinematic Proving Grounds
entry.summary: The Unioverse is a multimedia sci-fi franchise with plans to facilitate user-generated content. Decrypt reporter and GG producer Kate Irwin checked out the Unioverse as Reyu, an alien character, and navigated the Proving Grounds with him. In the Proving Grounds, you'll fight an array of different drone-like flying robots (some have tentacles!!) as you navigate the puzzle-like dystopian environment. Alien meets Portal, anyone?
